CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 27, 1952, pg. 22, reads: "Westinghouse Employe [Employee] Buried - The body of Charles W. Langhorne of 7234 Cushing Street, prominent East End resident, and Westinghouse veteran employe [sic] for over thirty years, is shown being carried from the Gaines Funeral home after services on Monday. He is survived by his widow, Mrs. Mary V. Langhorne, and one sister, Mrs. Seline Wilkinson of Washington, D. C.  Pallbearers are E. L. Smith, Russell Roberts, Richard Simmons, Harry Spriggs, Walter Walker, Fred Strothers, C. C. Clemmons and George Gaines, mortician. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: George Gaines leading pallbearers E. L. Smith, Russell Roberts, Richard Simmons, Harry Spriggs, Walter Walker, Fred Strothers, and C. C. Clemmons carrying casket of Charles W. Langhorne out of Gaines Funeral Home
CatSubject_tab: Gaines Funeral Home (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Gaines, George W.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Funeral rites and ceremonies--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Caskets--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.
